alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 6:27PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Drifting Snow and Slick Travel for Some Followed by Bitter Cold... .Light snow continues this evening with gusty winds leading to some drifting across roadways, particularly across open areas of southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa and far southwest Wisconsin. Bitterly cold air impacts the region tonight into the start of the new week with wind chill values of 25 to 40 degrees below zero. Limit time outdoors, if possible. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...Until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
